skill.name: action-item-organizer
skill.description: Systematic framework for extracting actionable items from documents and organizing them into prioritized, trackable checklists. Use when converting reports, meeting notes, audits, or any document with embedded action items into structured TODO lists.
skill.summary: Systematic framework for extracting actionable items from documents and organizing them into priorit...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation and templates. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or command execution capabilities. The skill provides organizational frameworks for converting unstructured documents into structured TODO lists.

content.user_title: Organize action items into prioritized checklists
content.value_statement: Managing action items from documents is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill provides a systematic framework to extract, prioritize, and structure action items into trackable markdown checklists with clear context and metadata.
actual_capabilities: Extract actionable items from unstructured documents and meeting notes
Classify tasks by priority (P0-P3) with clear criteria
Organize tasks into nested hierarchical checklists
Add metadata like file locations, owners, time estimates, and tracking IDs
Generate structured markdown TODO lists with completion tracking
Handle edge cases like missing priorities or duplicate items
limitations: Does not execute code or access files directly
Does not integrate with external task management tools
Does not send notifications or reminders
Output is limited to markdown checklist format

use_cases.title: Code Review to Tasks
use_cases.description: Convert code review reports into prioritized remediation checklists with file locations and time estimates

use_cases.title: Meeting Notes to Actions
use_cases.description: Transform scattered meeting notes into organized action items with owners, deadlines, and priorities

use_cases.title: Audit Findings to Work Items
use_cases.description: Structure security audit findings into prioritized remediation plans with compliance tracking

prompt_templates.title: Basic Extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Action Item Organizer skill to extract all action items from this document. Prioritize items by P0-P3. Include file paths and context for each item.

prompt_templates.title: Code Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert this code review report into a TODO list. Group by priority (P0 blockers first). Include file locations and time estimates. Add category prefixes (Security, Performance, etc.).

prompt_templates.title: Meeting Notes
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract action items from these meeting notes. Assign owners based on @mentions or context. Set priorities based on urgency language. Create nested checklists for complex tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Audit Remediation
prompt_templates.prompt: Transform this audit report into a prioritized remediation plan. Map risk levels to P0-P3. Include compliance context. Add tracking IDs and owner assignments for each finding.

output_examples.input: Convert this code review report into an organized TODO list with priorities and time estimates.
output: - **Context**: Public endpoint exposed without auth allows unauthorized access

best_practices: Always include context explaining why each task matters and what it achieves
Preserve file paths and line numbers to enable traceability and navigation
Use consistent priority criteria across all items to avoid inflation or deflation
anti_patterns: Creating flat lists instead of nesting related sub-tasks under parent items
Losing context by extracting only task titles without rationale or impact
Marking everything as P0 which defeats the purpose of prioritization

faq.question: Which document formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill works with any text-based document format including markdown, plain text, code comments, JSON, and YAML structured content.

faq.question: What is the maximum number of items this skill can handle?
faq.answer: There is no hard limit. The skill can organize hundreds of items into priority sections with nested sub-tasks and metadata.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with external tools like JIRA or GitHub Issues?
faq.answer: No. The skill outputs markdown format. You can manually copy tracking IDs or use the output as a template for external tools.

faq.question: Is user data stored or transmitted anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill. All processing happens within your AI session. No data is stored or transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why are my priorities being set incorrectly?
faq.answer: Check that you provided enough context about urgency and impact. Use explicit markers like P0, Critical, or blocking language. The skill relies on context clues when explicit priorities are missing.

faq.question: How is this different from a basic TODO list?
faq.answer: This skill adds structure with priority levels, metadata (files, owners, estimates), nested sub-tasks, traceability, and comprehensive output formatting designed for professional workflows.
